verbose_text: Resistant hypertension is defined as uncontrolled blood pressure despite the concurrent use of three different classes of antihypertensives, including a diuretic, calcium channel blocker, and renin-angiotensin system inhibitor.8 Screening test for PA is plasma aldosterone-renin ratio (ARR) that identifies excess plasma aldosterone production and suppression of plasma renin activity.
evidence: aldosterone production and suppression of plasma renin
